title: SHA256RNDS2 â€” Perform Two Rounds of SHA256 Operation

fields.name: Description
fields.value: The SHA256RNDS2 instruction performs 2 rounds of SHA256 operation using an initial SHA256 state (C,D,G,H) from the first operand, an initial SHA256 state (A,B,E,F) from the second operand, and a pre-computed sum of the next 2 round message dwords and the corresponding round constants from the implicit operand xmm0. Note that only the two lower dwords of XMM0 are used by the instruction.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The updated SHA256 state (A,B,E,F) is written to the first operand, and the second operand can be used as the updated state (C,D,G,H) in later rounds.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
